page.title: 12Employment
page.content: There is not much employment in our area, mostly it is agricultural although even then there are becoming less and less jobs for people to do. About twenty to twenty five people work on the land. Twenty people work for the Gas Board but out of those only one lives in the area. Two people work at the church, Mr McLaren and the caretaker Mr Pickering. There is a small riding stable near the church and it employs four girls part time to look after the horses. The light house empoys one man and Bulk Storage employ fourteen people as either storemen or lorry drivers.Out of these only two men are local men. There used to be losts of work as local fishermen but not any more because of the pollution in the river.
